content: I don't have personal experience, but i can tell you that during the early 20th century, the working conditions at the ford dagenham plant were very harsh. workers were expected to work long hours, often working 10-12 hour shifts, six days a week. the factory was hot and noisy, with no air conditioning, and minimal safety measures were in place. workers were often exposed to dangerous chemicals, and accidents were frequent. there were few breaks, and workers were under constant supervision. the work was repetitive and required a lot of physical labor, often resulting in injuries and health problems. pay was low, and jobs were highly competitive, with many workers willing to accept poor conditions in order to keep their jobs. the ford dagenham plant was known for its ruthless management practices, and workers had little voice or protection.
